title: The Week in Ransomware - September 15th 2023 - Russian Roulette
description: This week's big news is the extortion attacks on the Caesars and MGM Las Vegas casino chains, with one having already paid the ransom and the other still facing operational disruptions. [...]

title: Retool blames breach on Google Authenticator MFA cloud sync feature
description: Software company Retool says the accounts of 27 cloud customers were compromised following a targeted and multi-stage social engineering attack. [...]

title: Google extends security update support for Chromebooks to 10 years
description: Google has announced the Auto Update Expiration (AUE) date will be extended from 5 years to 10 for all Chromebooks, guaranteeing a decade of monthly security updates. [...]

title: Google pays $93M to settle Android tracking lawsuit in California
description: California's Attorney General announced today that Google will pay $93 million to settle a privacy lawsuit alleging it violated the U.S. state's consumer protection laws. [...]

title: ORBCOMM ransomware attack causes trucking fleet management outage
description: Trucking and fleet management solutions provider ORBCOMM has confirmed that a ransomware attack is causing recent service outages that prevent trucking companies from managing their fleets. [...]

title: TikTok slapped with $368 million fine over child privacy violations
description: The Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) has fined TikTok €345 million ($368 million) for violating the privacy of children between the ages of 13 and 17 while processing their data. [...]

title: Bing Chat AI is down, affecting Windows Copilot and more
description: Bing Chat, the famous ChatGPT-powered chatbot that allows users to converse with various personalities and topics has connectivity issues worldwide. [...]
